description.narrative: The Pacific Leadership Program (PLP) is a regional governance initiative which builds knowledge and awareness to support developmental leadership across the Pacific. PLP is particularly focused on transformational leadership that promotes inclusive, legitimate and durable institutional and policy changes addressing priority developmental problems and issues in the Pacific. PLP is always looking to better understand how, where and why local developmental leadership emerges and to identify the most appropriate support that can be provided by donors. PLP’s particular approach includes supporting the collective efforts and actions of Pacific Island leaders, already committed to resolving these problems and issues at the regional, national and sub-national levels. The Program aims to strengthen established and emerging leaders and leadership practice across a range of stakeholders in Pacific Island countries. Based in Suva, Fiji, the Program began operating in April 2008. Support has been
